title: Mobile Collaborative Mathematics Education for Adult Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge and practical application experience
context.additional_context: Distance collaborative learning environment using Web 2.0 tools, with digital devices provided.

learning_goals: Learners can share mathematical problem-solving processes in real-time and provide feedback using web-based collaboration tools (e.g., Google Jamboard, Padlet)
Learners can complete 15-minute microlearning content in a mobile environment and submit peer-evaluated collaborative assignments.
Learners can apply statistical reasoning techniques to real-life/workplace problems and create data-driven decision-making models in collaborative documents (e.g., Notion).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
